newsitem.title: GERMANY: German banker sees U.S. as key to investment banks.
newsitem.headline: German banker sees U.S. as key to investment banks.

text.p: In a bid to grab a bigger chunk of global investment banking activities, European investment banks must step up their activities in the U.S., a senior German banker said on Friday.

Ronaldo Schmitz, a board member at Germany's biggest commercial bank Deutsche Bank AG, told a banking congress: "I am convinced that Europeans will not have a chance to establish themselves permanently among the world's leading investment banks unless they obtain a critical mass in the United States."
A presence in the U.S. is particularly important so that bank can effectively participate in growing cross-border activities, Schmitz said, adding the U.S. was currently the world's biggest market.
German banks have recently stepped up efforts to make inroads into the lucrative market by forging alliances with some U.K. investment banks.
